docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column marvels at fact that Donald Trump appears to have become even more incoherent and antagonistic than usual in lead-up to Republican National Convention; notes Trump seems resentful at time when most major party nominees would be triumphal; expresses concern that global and national political climate may favor Trump presidency.

docs.abstract: Amanda Hess First Words column examines changing import of phrase 'politically correct' in lead-up to 2016 presidential election, as Donald Trump argues that political correctness, onetime Republican punch line, threatens public safety.

headline.main: How ‘Political Correctness’ Went From Punch Line to Panic

docs.abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin DealBook column says Donald J Trump and his vice presidential running mate Gov Mike Pence are far from being on same page policy-wise, but that divergence probably does not matter to Trump; holds pair are papering over many fiscal policy differences in interest of party unity.
